Drake appears to have offered to talk down a man standing on a Manchester bridge after playing a sell-out gig at the city's main concert venue. Comment Below 
Police say the singer became involved in the incident around 5:40am on Sunday morning, hours after finishing his gig at the Manchester Arena. 
Officers had been called to Mancunian Way bridge, because a man was standing on the wrong side of the barriers. 
Roads nearby were closed while they talked to the man and tailbacks began to form, reports the Manchester Evening News . Coleen arrives to watch Drake in Manchester last night (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Read More Coleen Rooney looks stylish in black as she and Wayne leave the kids at home head out to Drake gig in Manchester 
It is understood the tour bus carrying Drake and his entourage through the city centre were caught up in the traffic. 
Inspector Phil Spurgeon, of the City Centre Intergrated Neighbourhood Policing Team, said: "One officer was approached by a male from a tour van caught up in the traffic congestion, claiming to be part of Drake’s entourage. 
"He offered for Drake to speak to the male on the bridge, if that would help. The offer was declined with thanks." Wayne Rooney arrives at the Drake concert in Manchester last night (Photo: Zenpix Ltd) Read More 
The man was eventually taken to hospital for treatment after he was safely brought down from the bridge before 7am. 
He was taken to hospital for assessment. 
Just named the world’s biggest selling recording artist, Drake has drawn Manchester’s great and good to his performances at the arena, including Wayne and Coleen Rooney. Like us on Facebook
